content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: i love sudoku game
Like the idea! I don't know how many people from `Easy` are able to do this in the time, but it should be ok.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a challenging puzzle that, with the correct approach, is still solvable in 5 minutes.

A nice little puzzle. This condition was confusing to me because of the word "row" at the end:

`No row or column can have more than two of the same number in a row.`

I think the word sequence may be less confusing:

`No row or column may contain a sequence with more than two repeating digits (e.g. 1 1 0 is valid but 1 1 1 is invalid)`

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a valid puzzle. My only suggestion is to emphasise that validity of the rows should be checked before the columns.

The contribution is interesting.
I was thinking it was more easy but it's not so easy.
Finding double line is easy (column too) but you need to keep the information cause it can bug before the double line.
So, I like this contribution, if you pass it public, you can count on me to valid it.
Great job !
10 lines of code in Python... I'm afraid it's too easy! But maybe for the "Easy" category it's fine

Ah, sorry, it's for "clash of code!" Then it should be fine :)

Just one suggestion (to make it even more easier): remove spaces (i.e. just "010101" rather than space-separated "0 1 0 1 0 1") - this will make it even easier.
Thanks for the tip, I've updated the description as suggested. I'm glad you enjoyed it!

Thanks for the suggestion and for testing it out. :)

I tried it without spaces originally, but I found it was a bit harder to read the individual bits and see the columns, also it looks less like a sudoku when it's not a square. If others agree though, I can update.
